revised_title: Effects of Substratum on Primordial Germ Cell Migration
tldr: The article investigates the effects of substratum on the migration of primordial germ cells in early anuran amphibian embryos. The study shows that primordial germ cells align themselves with the shapes of the substrate cells or their stress fiber cytoskeleton, suggesting a link between orientation of the substrate cells and primordial germ cell guidance. The glycoprotein fibronectin is found to be involved in primordial germ cell adhesion, further indicating a connection between substrate orientation and cell guidance.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
